alert.note: Alert for Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 17 at 7:46PM EST until December 17 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Onslow County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 830 PM EST. * At 746 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Woodside to 27 miles east of Kure Beach, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, North Topsail Beach, New River Station, Half Moon, Camp Lejeune Center, Folkstone, Verona, Catherine Lake, Dixon, Albert J Ellis Airport, Richlands South, Sneads Ferry, Holly Ridge, and Haws Run. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
